result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:22 AM Defendant Dillon J. Hall in court.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman appeared by video for Dillon J. Hall.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.  Court reviews the court record.  Attny Chapman makes statement as to DEF missed appearance.  DEF makes statement to court as to missed appearance.   State indicates officers were present for a motion hearing in Case 22CF49.  Court reviews Justice Point violation.  Justice Point Representative K. Dussl, makes statement to court as to filed reports.  Attny Chapman makes statement as to violation report.  DEF makes statement as to missed Justice Point appointment.   Court has discussion with DEF.    State makes bond recommendation.  11:35 AM  OFF THE RECORD:   In Chambers Meeting with Attorneys.   11:39 AM  BACK ON THE RECORD:  Court makes statement as to discussion of meeting.     State makes bond statement.   Attny Chapman makes bond argument.  Court makes statement regarding bond.    Court reinstates bond SIBS $2500.

09:39 AM Defendant Dillon J. Hall in court with attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court calls case and recites appearances.  Attny Chapman indicates to proceed with preliminary hearing.   State calls witness, Investigator Poplin, Court sworn in.  State begins examination.   9:42 AM  Attny Chapman makes Objection, Identification- Court Overruled.  State re-asked questioned.   9:43 AM  Attny Chapman makes record on idenification. Discussion takes place.   9:45 AM  Witness identified the DEF, court indicates the record will reflect.  State continues examination.  Attny Chapman no questions.  9:47 AM  Witness excused.   No further witness by either party.   State request for bind over.  Attny Chapman no arguement.  Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.  Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-338-3976 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.
